sentence.Network_en: It is axiomatic that life is not always easy.
sentence.Network_cn: 生活并不总是一帆风顺，这是明摆着的事实。

sentence.Network_en: It is axiomatic that as people grow older they generally become less agile.
sentence.Network_cn: 人年纪越大通常灵活性越差，这是不言而喻的。

sentence.Network_en: It is axiomatic ( to say ) that a whole is greater than any of its parts.
sentence.Network_cn: 整体大于其任何一部分是 公理 .

GRE 词汇表(红宝书) - 豆丁网 ... axiom n. 公理,定理 axiomatic adj. 不需证明的,不言自明的 axis n. 轴(常为虚构之线,如地球轴).

axiomatic 公理的axiomatic method 公理法axiomatic set theory 公理论的集论;公理集合论.
本文中提出这一语言的两种语义,指称语义(Denotational Semantics)和公理化语义(Axiomatic Semantics)。但这两个语义中都回避了语言可能具有的某些不确定性,这一问题将.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from Greek axiōmatikos, from axiōma 'what is thought fitting' (see axiom)

entry.tran: 不言而喻的;不证自明的
entry.def: If something is axiomatic, it seems to be obviously true.

example.ex: It is axiomatic that as people grow older they generally become less agile.
example.tran: 人年纪越大通常灵活性越差，这是不言而喻的。

sentences.sentence: "we hold these truths to be self-evident"

means.word_mean: 3. of or relating to or derived from axioms;

sentences.sentence: "the postulational method was applied to geometry"- S.S.Stevens

auth_sentence.content: We may have to take existence as axiomatic.

auth_sentence.content: It is almost axiomatic that that has to be true.
